decks.notes: This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting and controlling the opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption, counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to establish board control and protect its win conditions while steadily draining the opponent's resources. By efficiently dealing with threats and out-valuing the opponent, this deck aims to grind out a win through attrition and control the pace of the game. With a mix of disruption and powerful threats, this deck is designed to outmaneuver and outlast its opponent in a game of resource management.

This deck focuses on playing a variety of aggressive creatures and using Leyline cards to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It utilizes powerful cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, Scion of Draco, and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to deal damage quickly. The inclusion of cards like Stubborn Denial and Lightning Bolt allows for both disruption and removal of opposing threats. The deck also includes lands that provide flexibility in mana fixing to ensure the deck can consistently play its threats.

This deck focuses on aggressively disrupting your opponent's plays while also generating value through cards like Quantum Riddler and Ephemerate. Consign to Memory helps control the board while cards like Galvanic Discharge and Prismatic Ending provide removal options. Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Arena of Glory provide additional ways to generate advantage. The deck also includes a small elemental sub-theme with cards like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. Wrath of the Skies acts as a board wipe option, while Elegant Parlor and Meticulous Archive offer card draw and filtering. Thundering Falls and Sacred Foundry round out the mana base for consistency.

The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Ruby Medallion and Ral, Monsoon Mage to generate mana quickly and cast spells like Grapeshot and Past in Flames to deal massive damage to the opponent in one turn. The deck also includes cards like Manamorphose and Reckless Impulse to help draw into key combo pieces. The goal is to win the game through a powerful combo turn where the opponent is overwhelmed by a flurry of spells and spellslinger abilities.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Birthing Ritual and Leyline Binding, allowing you to play powerful threats like Elesh Norn, Magmatic Hellkite, and Omnath, Locus of Creation. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Negation and Solitude to control the board and protect your key cards. With a mix of powerful creatures and efficient spells, this aggro deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with a combination of early aggression and late-game power.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Sire of Seven Deaths. It also utilizes control elements like Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Command to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Devourer of Destiny and Writhing Chrysalis provides additional value by generating tokens or card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its powerful threats while controlling the game through various spells and abilities.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly and efficiently to cast multiple spells in a single turn, ultimately leading to a big combo finish with cards like Grapeshot or Glimpse the Impossible. The deck includes various rituals and spell cost reducers like Ruby Medallion to facilitate this strategy. It also includes cards like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Past in Flames to recur spells from the graveyard. The goal is to cast a high number of spells in a single turn to overwhelm the opponent and win the game in a explosive manner.

The deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures that can be searched for and deployed strategically to create powerful synergies and combos. The key strategy involves utilizing cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Spymaster's Vault to find and play creatures such as Agatha's Soul Cauldron, Yawgmoth, Thran Physician, and Walking Ballista to control the board and outvalue the opponent. The deck is built around efficient creature interactions and resource management to outmaneuver and overwhelm the opponent in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The core concept of this deck is to quickly flood the board with artifacts, leveraging cards like Mox Opal, Urza's Saga, and Thoughtcast for mana advantage and card draw. By utilizing artifact creatures like Memnite, Pinnacle Emissary, and Arcbound Ravager, the deck aims to apply early pressure and overwhelm opponents with a combination of aggressive creatures and powerful artifacts. Engineered Explosives and Claws of Gix provide removal and utility, while Tormod's Crypt disrupts graveyard strategies. The deck's synergy and speed make it well-suited for aggressive gameplay in the Modern format.

This deck revolves around assembling the Allosaurus Combo using cards like Allosaurus Rider, Eldritch Evolution, and Neoform to tutor for and cheat out powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant. The deck also includes various support cards like Disciple of Freyalise and Planar Genesis to ramp up mana and generate value. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with big creatures and powerful abilities, while also utilizing cards like Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer for protection.

This deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly through spells like Pyretic Ritual and Desperate Ritual, along with Wrenn's Resolve to untap lands. It aims to cast a massive Grapeshot or use Ral, Monsoon Mage's -8 ability to deal lethal damage to the opponent. The deck also utilizes Past in Flames to cast spells from the graveyard and has access to Wish for toolbox options. The overall strategy is to assemble the combo pieces while controlling the board with cards like Strike It Rich and Ral, Monsoon Mage.

The deck revolves around generating mana quickly with rituals and utilizing Ral, Monsoon Mage's ability to copy spells. It aims to cast a high number of spells in one turn to overwhelm the opponent with damage from cards like Grapeshot and Strike It Rich. The deck also includes ways to dig for key pieces of the combo with cards like Glimpse the Impossible and Reckless Impulse. Additionally, it includes cards like Wish and Valakut Awakening for added flexibility and card advantage. Overall, the deck is focused on assembling the combo pieces quickly to win the game in a single explosive turn.

The deck focuses on using artifacts to quickly build a board presence and control the game. By utilizing cards like Mox Opal, Mishra's Bauble, and Urza's Saga, the deck can generate mana and threats efficiently. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Memory Guardian provide additional value by recurring artifacts from the graveyard. The deck also includes disruption like Metallic Rebuke and Pithing Needle to deal with opponent's threats. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression, card advantage, and disruption.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while maintaining a strong aggressive presence on the battlefield. It combines removal spells like Fatal Push and Solitude with disruptive creatures like Thoughtseize and Flickerwisp to control the board and disrupt the opponent's plans. This allows for aggressive creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Overlord of the Balemurk to quickly take control and pressure the opponent. Additionally, cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Ephemerate provide additional disruption and utility to help maintain tempo and keep the opponent off balance.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively overwhelm the opponent with a mix of powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, alongside burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment. The deck aims to control the board and deal damage swiftly, utilizing cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Guide of Souls for additional support. Additionally, cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Voice of Victory provide card advantage and strategic options, while cards like Blood Moon can disrupt the opponent's mana base.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with aggressive creatures, backed up with burn spells and enchantments to control the board. The deck aims to establish early pressure with efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, while utilizing cards like Goblin Bombardment and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah for additional reach and removal. The inclusion of Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Arena of Glory provides alternate win conditions and resilience against opposing strategies, making this deck a versatile and powerful choice for aggressive players in Modern.
